comments: The station Lison (ICOS code IT-Lsn) is located in the middle of an extended vineyard, on a flat terrain of Venice region (Lison di Portogruaro, province of Venice), North-East Italy. The vineyard, established in 2001, is about 33 ha and surrounded by other vineyards, has the vine rows oriented to 35 ? 125 N. Rows are spaced 2.2 m apart and are approximately 0.5 m wide; plant spacing is 0.9 m and the canopy height at full development is 2 m. The vineyard alleys are covered by permanent grass, regularly mowed during the season, while the soil below plants on the row is chemically weeded for a strip of about 0.7 m width. Eddy covariance measurements started in May 2014. Canopy height at full development is 2 m, the vine growing season is from April to September. The alleys are covered with spontaneous herbaceous vegetation.
self.label: IT-Lsn

documentation.name: IT-Lsn Associated ICOS Ecosystem Station Labelling Report.pdf

comments: Lands with woody vegetation less than 2 meters tall and with shrub canopy cover between 10-60%. The shrub foliage can be either evergreen or deciduous.
ecosystemType.label: Open Shrublands
